p: Viral suppression is defined as a plasma viral load less than 1000 copies of viral RNA. The level of resistance refers to the proportion of patients having at least one major INSTI resistance mutation. The immune recovery of a patient refers to the CD4 count > 500 cells/mm 3 following treatment according to individual studies. Adherence refers to the number of missing dosage as defined by the individual studies. Adverse event refers to side effects of INSTI reported in the individual studies and classified as severe/serious and mere/moderate. Subtypes or recombinants refer to the viral strains identified in a patient sample.
